Class dom.session.ViewDObjectFacet 

java.lang.Object
    |
    +----dom.session.ViewDObjectFacet
public final class ViewDObjectFacet
extends java.lang.Object
Facet that the View provides the DObject upon construction. This is provided so that the DObject has certain minimal capabilities provided by the View (e.g.) getting it's id, querying about group membership, sending data reliably and with FIFO ordering to our remote presences.

The class is declared final, meaning that no subclasses can be created. This guarantees certain minimal functionality for the DObject that receives this facet.

Author:
Scott Lewis
Source Code:
ViewDObjectFacet.java

Constructor Detail

ViewDObjectFacet

protected ViewDObjectFacet(View aView) throws NullFacetException
Constructor takes as a parameter the View instance that this facet protects. If this parameter is null, this facet cannot be created, and so throws a NullFacetException.

Declared protected so that only code in the dom.session package has access to creating instances of this facet class. Currently this is done only in the DObject root class constructor.

Note that the method setDObjectTarget() is called by the DObject class constructor to set the DObject that is the target for this facet. Once set in the DObject class constructor, it cannot be changed (it is settable only once).

Parameters:
aView - the View instance that this facet is a public interface for
Throws:
NullFacetException - thrown if either parameter is null upon construction
Method Detail

setDObjectTarget

protected void setDObjectTarget(DObject theObject)
Set up DObject target for this facet class. This method allows the DObject initialization code to set the target DObject instance for this facet. This is called *once* from the DObject class constructor, and can only be called successfully that one time. Any subsequent attempts to reset the target DObject for this facet will be ignored.
Parameters:
theObject - the DObject to set as this facet's target DObject

revoked

private boolean revoked()
Helper function to determine whether this facet is in a 'revoked' state or not
Returns:
true if facet has been revoked, false otherwise

revoke

public void revoke()
Public method to allow View (or anything else that has a handle on this facet for that matter) to revoke this facet and make it inactive. Normally, this is called by the View, as part of its cleanup process when a DObject is removed.

getID

public SessionViewID getID()
Get the SessionViewID associated with this View facet. This lets the receiving DObject ask what the SessionViewID for the the local View instance.
Returns:
SessionViewID that is the unique id associated with the local View

isServer

public boolean isServer() throws NullFacetException
Allow receivers of this facet to ask whether the owner View of a facet is a server or not (i.e. the machine that does message fanout). This is only informational...i.e. it allows the DObject to *ask*, but the underlying View is not obligated to tell the truth (although I can't really think of a reason why it wouldn't tell the truth).
Returns:
true if View is a server (message fanout machine), false otherwise
Throws:
NullFacetException - thrown if this facet has been revoked

getDObjectRunQueue

protected Enqueable getDObjectRunQueue()
Get a run queue that a DObject can use to execute its code. This is called by the DObject constructor, to get an Enqueable object so that Closures can be put on this run queue. This gives the View the power to determine the characteristics of the run queue that DObjects use to execute their code. The View can determine if it is one run queue (and one thread) used for all DObjects or a separate run queue (and thread of execution) for every DObject.
Returns:
Enqueable for DObject to use. Null is a possibility if request for Enqueable is refused by View

sendDataToPresences

public void sendDataToPresences(Data data) throws java.io.IOException
Send given Data object to all remote presences known to be in the group.
Parameters:
data - any Data to be sent to all presences
Throws:
java.io.IOException - thrown if data cannot be sent (e.g. not in group at all)

sendDataToPresenceAtView

public void sendDataToPresenceAtView(SessionViewID id,
                                     Data data) throws java.io.IOException
Send given Data object to presence at given remote presence.
Parameters:
id - the SessionViewID that we are directing the data to
data - any Data to be sent to all presences
Throws:
java.io.IOException - thrown if data cannot be sent (e.g. not in group at all)

sendCreateMsg

public void sendCreateMsg(SessionViewID id,
                          CreateDObjectData data)
Send a create message from the local presence to a remote view. This will likely result in a remote client presence being created.
Parameters:
id - the SessionViewID to send the create request to
data - the CreateDObjectData information needed to construct the remote presence

getViewFacet

public BaseFacet getViewFacet(java.lang.String request,
                              java.lang.Object data)
Generic meta-interface for DObjects to get facets on the local view. This interface can be used to make arbitrary requests of the local view securely. The untrusted subclass of this class cannot call the view.getViewFacet method directly, but rather only through this call.
Parameters:
request - a String identifying the desired service from the view
data - arbitrary data associated with the request
Returns:
BaseFacet that is a facet on the local view. Can be null if view does not wish to provide a facet for the service.

notifyDObjectCreated

protected void notifyDObjectCreated()
Notification from DObject (parameter is provided as key to assure identity), that DObject has received and processed the 'created' message from the local view. This is passed on to the view list manager, so that it can deal with this notification as desired (typically by making some other state change on the DObject).

notifyDObjectActivated

protected void notifyDObjectActivated()
Notification from DObject (parameter is provided as key to assure identity), that DObject has received and processed the 'activated' message from the local view. This is passed on to the view list manager, so that it can deal with this notification as desired (typically by making some other state change on the DObject).

notifyDObjectDeactivated

protected void notifyDObjectDeactivated()
Notification from DObject (parameter is provided as key to assure identity), that DObject has received and processed the 'deactivated' message from the local view. This is passed on to the view list manager, so that it can deal with this notification as desired (typically by making some other state change on the DObject).

notifyDObjectDestroyed

protected void notifyDObjectDestroyed()
Notification from DObject (parameter is provided as key to assure identity), that DObject has received and processed the 'destroyed' message from the local view. This is passed on to the view list manager, so that it can deal with this notification as desired (typically by making some other state change on the DObject).

requestCapability

protected void requestCapability(DObjectID target,
                                 java.lang.String requestName,
                                 java.lang.Object data) throws java.lang.Exception
Method for DObjects to make requests on other DObjects for capabilities. This method serves as the meta interface for all DObject capability negotiation.
Parameters:
id - the DObjectID of the DObject we wish to make the request of (grantor)
requestName - the request name (cannot be null)
data - any Object representing data specific to the request
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown under different failure conditions
See Also:
requestDObjectCapability, requestCapability, receiveCapability, giveDObjectCapability, receiveCapability

receiveCapability

protected void receiveCapability(CapabilityReceipt aReceipt) throws java.lang.Exception
Method called by DObject that is *granting* a capability request, if it chooses to do so. DObjects will receive requests for capabilities (via the View#requestDObjectCapability method). If capabilities are granted in response to these requests, the grantor should: a) Create an instance of a DObjectFacet (or some subclass) b) Call the receipt.setFacet(DObjectFacet) method to set the facet for the given receipt c) Call this method on its ViewDObjectFacet This method will then call the View.receiveDObjectCapability method, which will, in turn, deliver the contained DObjectFacet back to the the original requestor (if they are still there)
Parameters:
aReceipt - the CapabilityReceipt originally provided the grantor from the View. If null, a NullPointerException will be thrown
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown under different failure conditions

addDObjectListener

protected void addDObjectListener()
Interface for DObjects to request that they be added as listeners for other DObject arrival. This is invoked by the method DObject.addDObjectListener and it in turn invokes the method on the underlying View object.

removeDObjectListener

protected void removeDObjectListener()
Interface for DObjects to request that they be removed as listeners for other DObject arrival/departure. This is invoked by the method DObject.removeDObjectListener and itin turn invokes the method on the underlying View object.

recycleDObject

protected final void recycleDObject() throws java.lang.Exception
Destroy the DObject that has access to this facet. This is the method that a DObject calls on its ViewDObjectFacet to permanently destroy itself. After calling this, the DObject will eventually die.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if some problem with eliminating DObject
